string-array.name: help_texts
string-array.item:
Substrate is a collection of live wallpapers for Android.
\ 
\ A live wallpaper is a wallpaper which runs in the background of your home screen, displaying a constantly-changing backdrop. This application is a collection of live wallpapers (a.k.a. "screen hacks") based on the beautiful work of J.Tarbell. Each one displays a slowly growing pattern which gradually evolves in your home screen.
\ 
\ Note that this app only previews the live wallpapers. To actually set one as your wallpaper, see "Installing" below.

To set one of these hacks as your wallpaper, you need to install it as follows:
\ 
\ • Go to your home screen.
\ 
\ • Press the menu key.
\ 
\ • Select "Wallpaper", then "Live wallpapers".
\ 
\ • Pick your preferred wallpaper.

Within the Substrate application, the device's "menu" button pops up a menu containing a number of options:
\ 
\ • Select hack selects the screen hack to preview in the application.
\ 
\ • Hack preferences pops up the preferences panel for the currently displayed hack. The preferences you select here affect the hack globally, so if it is currently running in your home screen, you can change its settings from here rather than needing to re-install it. See "The Hacks" below for details.
\ 
\ • Help displays this help.
\ 
\ • About displays an about box, with links to the license and the project home page.
\ 
\ • Exit stops the Substrate application. This doesn't affect your wallpaper.
This section provides details on each of the live wallpapers — \"hacks\" — available in this package, including details of the settings available in each hack.
If you would like more information and help with Substrate, or if you want to to report a bug, there are some on-line resources which may be of interest, as described in the following sections.

string-array.item: There is a discussion board where you can suggest ideas for Substrate, share experiences and thoughts with other users, and generally waffle. Please note that this group is shared with the other Moonblink projects, so mention Substrate when you post:\n\ \n\ • http://groups.google.com/group/moonblink/topics

If you want to report a bug, you can use the Moonblink Issue tracker. Before you post, please look through the existing issues -- including closed issues -- before raising a new one. Your problem may already have been solved.
\ 
\ If you do need to raise a new issue:
\ • The issue tracker is used by a number of projects. Please click on the "Product-" label to set the product you are reporting against. You can also set the other fields as appropriate.
\ • Please tell me what device, and what version of Android, you are using.
\ • If the bug is a crash, then please attach a log if you possibly can. If you don't know how, don't sweat it.
\ 
\ So, the issue tracker is here:
\ 
\ • http://code.google.com/p/moonblink/issues/list
Substrate is an open project, so if you want to join in and make contributions, you can. See the project page for information:\n\ \n\ • http://code.google.com/p/moonblink/wiki/Substrate
